item.title: Variational Autoencoders for Single-Cell Genomics
item.description: Introduction Like many fields with large multi-variate datasets, single-cell genomics benefits widely from deep generative models like Variational Autoencoders (VAEs). The purpose of this tutorial is to explain how generative modeling, particularly VAEs, are used in this subfield of bioinformatics. Specifically, we will cover the biological background of single-cell sequencing and the computational problems that arise from there. Then we will propose a Bayesian formulation of said problems and present the mathematical models used to fit mutli-omic single-cell data.
